intro: Schkuhria pedata, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a velvety texture. Schkuhria pedata thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners in warm climates. It is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
